intro: Pithecoctenium dolichoides, commonly known as the slender horse-tail, is a tropical plant native to regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy environments and has small, grass-like leaves. It is often found in swampy areas and can form dense mats on the ground. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
